verses.text: Hear my voice when I call, O LORD; be merciful to me and answer me.
My heart says of you, "Seek his face!" Your face, LORD, I will seek.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 27:8
rsbNotes.text: 27:8 face. To seek God’s face is to seek intimate fellowship with Him.

verses.text: Do not hide your face from me, do not turn your servant away in anger; you have been my helper. Do not reject me or forsake me, O God my Savior.
Though my father and mother forsake me, the LORD will receive me.
Teach me your way, O LORD; lead me in a straight path because of my oppressors.
Do not turn me over to the desire of my foes, for false witnesses rise up against me, breathing out violence.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 27:9
rsbNotes.text: 27:9 Hide not your face. The psalmist recognizes that, however great his desire, he can only see God’s face if God reveals it.

verses.text: I am still confident of this: I will see the goodness of the LORD in the land of the living.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 27:13
rsbNotes.text: 27:13 goodness of the Lord. He is confident of God’s vindication while he is still alive.

verses.text: Wait for the LORD; be strong and take heart and wait for the LORD.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 27:14
rsbNotes.text: 27:14 Wait for the Lord. His counsel is, “In the midst of present trouble, do not give up; give God time to answer.”
